title: Potential energy - egg on vertical spring

content.description: A vertical spring is at its unstretched length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> when an egg is gently placed on the spring, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The egg is then slowly lowered until it reaches equilibrium and remains at rest, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the change in the gravitational potential energy <math alttext="delta U sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math> of the Earth-egg system and the change in the potential energy of the spring, <math alttext="delta U sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>?
content.question: <math alttext="delta U sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math><math alttext="delta U sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>APositivePositiveBPositiveNegativeCNegativePositiveDNegativeNegative

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
